Facebook Campaign Best Practices

üìÖ Post Timing

Post during peak hours: 6-9 PM weekdays and 11 AM-1 PM weekends for maximum visibility and engagement.

üé® Visual Content

Always include images or videos. Posts with visuals get 2-3x more engagement than text-only posts.

üí¨ Engage Authentically

Respond to comments and messages promptly. Building genuine connections is key to campaign success.

#Ô∏è‚É£ Smart Hashtags

Use 5-10 relevant hashtags per post. Mix popular ones (#Vote) with niche ones (#LocalCouncil2025).

üéØ Call to Action

Always include a clear CTA: Vote, Share, Comment, or Attend. Make it easy for supporters to help.

üìä Monitor Analytics

Track reach, engagement, and shares. Use insights to refine your content strategy weekly.

Social Media Platform Strategy

üìò Facebook

Older demographics, detailed posts, community groups. Best for: Town halls, events, detailed policy discussions. Post daily 6-9 PM.

üì∏ Instagram

Visual storytelling, younger audiences, Reels. Best for: Behind-the-scenes, day-in-life, carousel posts. Post 3-5x weekly, Reels 2-3x weekly.

üéµ TikTok

Gen Z, trending sounds, viral challenges. Best for: Quick facts, challenges, humor, authenticity. Post 4-7x weekly for algorithm boost.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è YouTube

Long-form content, in-depth explanations. Best for: Campaign launches, policy breakdowns, testimonials. Upload weekly for consistency.

üìä Cross-Platform Tips

Use consistent branding, repurpose content, engage authentically on all platforms, respond to comments within 24 hours.

üéØ Timing Strategy

Post when your audience is online. Facebook: evenings. Instagram: lunch/evening. TikTok: 6-10 AM & 7-11 PM. YouTube: Tuesday/Thursday.
